qas.question: What airport provides service to the City to Charleston?
The Charleston International Airport is located in what city?
How far is the airport from downtown Charleston?
Charleston Executive Airport is located where?

answers.text: the John's Island section of the city of Charleston

qas.question: What military base is located near the airport?
What airport provides no service to the City to Charleston?
The Charleston International Airport isn't located in what city?
How far is the airport from uptown Charleston?

plausible_answers.text: the John's Island section of the city of Charleston

qas.question: Charleston Executive Airport isn't located where?
What military base is located nowhere near the airport?

context: The City of Charleston is served by the <a0_0><b5_0>Charleston International Airport<b5_0/><a0_0/>. It is located in the City of <a1_0><b6_0>North Charleston<b6_0/><a1_0/> and is about <a2_0><b7_0>12 miles (20 km)<b7_0/><a2_0/> northwest of downtown Charleston. It is the busiest passenger airport in South Carolina (IATA: CHS, ICAO: KCHS). The airport shares runways with the adjacent <a4_0><b9_0>Charleston Air Force Base<b9_0/><a4_0/>. Charleston Executive Airport is a smaller airport located in <a3_0><b8_0>the John's Island section of the city of Charleston<b8_0/><a3_0/> and is used by noncommercial aircraft. Both airports are owned and operated by the Charleston County Aviation Authority.
